description: Provides information about the specified transcription job. To view the status of the specified transcription job, check the TranscriptionJobStatus field. If the status is COMPLETED, the job is finished. You can find the results at the location specified in TranscriptFileUri. If the status is FAILED, FailureReason provides details on why your transcription job failed. If you enabled content redaction, the redacted transcript can be found at the location specified in RedactedTranscriptFileUri. To get a list of your transcription jobs, use the operation.

parameters.name: TranscriptionJobName
parameters.description: The name of the transcription job you want information about. Job names are case sensitive.

nested_items.name: TranscriptionJob
nested_items.description: Provides detailed information about the specified transcription job, including job status and, if applicable, failure reason.

nested_items.name: TranscriptionJobName
nested_items.description: The name of the transcription job. Job names are case sensitive and must be unique within an Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: TranscriptionJobStatus
nested_items.description: Provides the status of the specified transcription job.

nested_items.name: LanguageCode
nested_items.description: The language code used to create your transcription job. This parameter is used with single-language identification. For multi-language identification requests, refer to the plural version of this parameter, LanguageCodes.

nested_items.name: MediaSampleRateHertz
nested_items.description: The sample rate, in hertz, of the audio track in your input media file.

nested_items.name: MediaFormat
nested_items.description: The format of the input media file.

nested_items.name: MediaFileUri
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location of the media file you want to transcribe. For example:
s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET/my-media-file.flac.
s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET/media-files/my-media-file.flac.

nested_items.name: RedactedMediaFileUri
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location of the media file you want to redact. For example:
s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET/my-media-file.flac.
s3://DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET/media-files/my-media-file.flac.

nested_items.name: Transcript
nested_items.description: Provides you with the Amazon S3 URI you can use to access your transcript.

nested_items.name: TranscriptFileUri
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location of your transcript. You can use this URI to access or download your transcript.

nested_items.name: RedactedTranscriptFileUri
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location of your redacted transcript. You can use this URI to access or download your transcript.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The date and time the specified transcription job began processing.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The date and time the specified transcription job request was made.

nested_items.name: CompletionTime
nested_items.description: The date and time the specified transcription job finished processing.

nested_items.name: FailureReason
nested_items.description: If TranscriptionJobStatus is FAILED, FailureReason contains information about why the transcription job request failed.
Unsupported media format. The media format specified in MediaFormat isn't valid. Refer to refer to the MediaFormat parameter for a list of supported formats.

The media format provided does not match the detected media format. The media format specified in MediaFormat doesn't match the format of the input file. Check the media format of your media file and correct the specified value.
Invalid sample rate for audio file. The sample rate specified in MediaSampleRateHertz isn't valid. The sample rate must be between 8,000 and 48,000 hertz.

The sample rate provided does not match the detected sample rate. The sample rate specified in MediaSampleRateHertz doesn't match the sample rate detected in your input media file. Check the sample rate of your media file and correct the specified value.
Invalid file size: file size too large. The size of your media file is larger than what Amazon Transcribe can process. For more information, refer to Service quotas.
Invalid number of channels: number of channels too large. Your audio contains more channels than Amazon Transcribe is able to process. For more information, refer to Service quotas.

nested_items.name: VocabularyName
nested_items.description: The name of the custom vocabulary you want to use in your transcription job request. This name is case sensitive, cannot contain spaces, and must be unique within an Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: ShowSpeakerLabels
nested_items.description: Enables speaker partitioning (diarization) in your transcription output. Speaker partitioning labels the speech from individual speakers in your media file.

nested_items.name: MaxSpeakerLabels
nested_items.description: Specify the maximum number of speakers you want to partition in your media.

nested_items.name: ChannelIdentification
nested_items.description: Enables channel identification in multi-channel audio.

nested_items.name: ShowAlternatives
nested_items.description: To include alternative transcriptions within your transcription output, include ShowAlternatives in your transcription request.

nested_items.name: MaxAlternatives
nested_items.description: Indicate the maximum number of alternative transcriptions you want Amazon Transcribe to include in your transcript.

nested_items.name: VocabularyFilterName
nested_items.description: The name of the custom vocabulary filter you want to use in your transcription job request. This name is case sensitive, cannot contain spaces, and must be unique within an Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: VocabularyFilterMethod
nested_items.description: Specify how you want your custom vocabulary filter applied to your transcript.

nested_items.name: ModelSettings
nested_items.description: Provides information on the custom language model you included in your request.

nested_items.name: LanguageModelName
nested_items.description: The name of the custom language model you want to use when processing your transcription job. Note that custom language model names are case sensitive.

nested_items.name: JobExecutionSettings
nested_items.description: Provides information about how your transcription job was processed. This parameter shows if your request was queued and what data access role was used.

nested_items.name: AllowDeferredExecution
nested_items.description: Makes it possible to enable job queuing when your concurrent request limit is exceeded. When AllowDeferredExecution is set to true, transcription job requests are placed in a queue until the number of jobs falls below the concurrent request limit. If AllowDeferredExecution is set to false and the number of transcription job requests exceed the concurrent request limit, you get a LimitExceededException error.

nested_items.name: DataAccessRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that has permissions to access the Amazon S3 bucket that contains your input files. If the role that you specify doesn't have the appropriate permissions to access the specified Amazon S3 location, your request fails.

nested_items.name: ContentRedaction
nested_items.description: Indicates whether redaction was enabled in your transcript.

nested_items.name: RedactionType
nested_items.description: Specify the category of information you want to redact; PII (personally identifiable information) is the only valid value. You can use PiiEntityTypes to choose which types of PII you want to redact. If you do not include PiiEntityTypes in your request, all PII is redacted.

nested_items.name: RedactionOutput
nested_items.description: Specify if you want only a redacted transcript, or if you want a redacted and an unredacted transcript.

nested_items.name: PiiEntityTypes
nested_items.description: Specify which types of personally identifiable information (PII) you want to redact in your transcript. You can include as many types as you'd like, or you can select ALL. If you do not include PiiEntityTypes in your request, all PII is redacted.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: IdentifyLanguage
nested_items.description: Indicates whether automatic language identification was enabled ( TRUE) for the specified transcription job.

nested_items.name: IdentifyMultipleLanguages
nested_items.description: Indicates whether automatic multi-language identification was enabled ( TRUE) for the specified transcription job.

nested_items.name: LanguageOptions
nested_items.description: Provides the language codes you specified in your request.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: IdentifiedLanguageScore
nested_items.description: The confidence score associated with the language identified in your media file.

nested_items.name: LanguageCodes
nested_items.description: The language codes used to create your transcription job. This parameter is used with multi-language identification. For single-language identification requests, refer to the singular version of this parameter, LanguageCode.

nested_items.name: LanguageCode
nested_items.description: Provides the language code for each language identified in your media.

nested_items.name: DurationInSeconds
nested_items.description: Provides the total time, in seconds, each identified language is spoken in your media.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags, each in the form of a key:value pair, assigned to the specified transcription job.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The first part of a key:value pair that forms a tag associated with a given resource. For example, in the tag Department:Sales, the key is --Department'.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The second part of a key:value pair that forms a tag associated with a given resource. For example, in the tag Department:Sales, the value is --Sales'.

nested_items.name: Subtitles
nested_items.description: Indicates whether subtitles were generated with your transcription.

nested_items.name: Formats
nested_items.description: Provides the format of your subtitle files. If your request included both WebVTT ( vtt) and SubRip ( srt) formats, both formats are shown.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SubtitleFileUris
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location of your transcript. You can use this URI to access or download your subtitle file. Your subtitle file is stored in the same location as your transcript. If you specified both WebVTT and SubRip subtitle formats, two URIs are provided.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: OutputStartIndex
nested_items.description: Provides the start index value for your subtitle files. If you did not specify a value in your request, the default value of 0 is used.

nested_items.name: LanguageIdSettings
nested_items.description: Provides the name and language of all custom language models, custom vocabularies, and custom vocabulary filters that you included in your request.

nested_items.name: do not
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: VocabularyName
nested_items.description: The name of the custom vocabulary you want to use when processing your transcription job. Custom vocabulary names are case sensitive.

nested_items.name: VocabularyFilterName
nested_items.description: The name of the custom vocabulary filter you want to use when processing your transcription job. Custom vocabulary filter names are case sensitive.

nested_items.name: LanguageModelName
nested_items.description: The name of the custom language model you want to use when processing your transcription job. Note that custom language model names are case sensitive.

nested_items.name: ToxicityDetection
nested_items.description: Provides information about the toxicity detection settings applied to your transcription.

nested_items.name: ToxicityCategories
nested_items.description: If you include ToxicityDetection in your transcription request, you must also include ToxicityCategories. The only accepted value for this parameter is ALL.
(string) ---
